intro: Petalonyx thurberi subsp. thurberi, commonly known as the Thurber's petalonyx, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of North America. It is characterized by its delicate, often fragrant flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands or stream banks. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, while its stems are slender and often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
